## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/structs/extension">Extension</a> point for the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> hierarchy.

All classes outside of lib/IR that wish to inherit from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> should instead inherit from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/deriveduser">DerivedUser</a> instead. Inheriting from this class is discouraged.

Generally speaking, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> is the base of a closed class hierarchy that can&#39;t be extended by code outside of lib/IR. This class creates a loophole that allows classes outside of lib/IR to extend <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> to leverage its use/def list machinery.

Definition at line 27 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/deriveduser-h">DerivedUser.h</a>.
